Posted By: Concerned_Bystander (1/5/2011 3:21:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is incredibly broken. I don't know what WotC was smoking when they play test this.
  
   
Even if it only has the 0 loyalty ability, it is still broken. Hell, it would still broken if that only reads: :Draw a card
  
Even if the opponent kills it the turn it dropped, a card is still drawn, card advantage is always guaranteed. If the opponent don't managed to do it, the card advantage gained would have been impossible to recover.
  
   
Did an artifact, enchantment, or creature costed CMC![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol) and lets you draw a card the turn it comes to play and every other your turn without any payment? NO.
  
   
It is just extremely ridiculous to have printed a card like this. I'd agree this card should cost at least ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) to play for its functions, and even so it is still a viable kill card.
  
   
   
In response to those who said there are so many cards that can deal with this: This card is actually the counter to your spell if you think about it. All I have to do is to drop this and get a card from my lib... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This card is incredibly broken. I don't know what WotC was smoking when they play test this.

Even if it only has the 0 loyalty ability, it is still broken. Hell, it would still broken if that only reads: :Draw a card
Even if the opponent kills it the turn it dropped, a card is still drawn, card advantage is always guaranteed. If the opponent don't managed to do it, the card advantage gained would have been impossible to recover.

Did an artifact, enchantment, or creature costed CMC and lets you draw a card the turn it comes to play and every other your turn without any payment? NO.

It is just extremely ridiculous to have printed a card like this. I'd agree this card should cost at least to play for its functions, and even so it is still a viable kill card.


In response to those who said there are so many cards that can deal with this: This card is actually the counter to your spell if you think about it. All I have to do is to drop this and get a card from my lib... (see all)

posts.post_content:
@ infernox10: That assumes people have the same rating priorites as you. Yes, Jace is one of the most powerful planeswalkers. However, I can't agree that even the best of planeswalkers deserve a 5/5 rating. To me, a card that deserves a five is something truly absurd -- like [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus), [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will), and [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker). I rated Jace a 4.5/5 because I understand he's very strong, but not format-breaking strong like the cards I reserve a "5" for.
  
   
Sure, I bet anything he's been hate-rated many times. But a rating less than five doesn't automatically indicate trolling.

posts.post_content:
Thought about going to FNM last week.  
  
Called ahead, and found out they were doing constructed instead of draft.  
  
Thoughts of facing down a super-Jace deck run through my head. Instead of going to FNM, meeting new players, proliferating the popularity of the constructed game, & supporting local business, I call up friends to play around the kitchen table that don't feel the need to spend $800+ dollars to play a game.  
  
I wonder how many other players do that?  
  
On a side note, after reading the first comments on this card, it's amazing how much opinion has changed over time.

Posted By: penguinmage25 (4/20/2011 2:19:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card, to me, encapsulates all that is blue. It's controlling--allowing one to influence top-deck draws for one's self and one's opponent. The -1 [unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=unsummon) can also be a game changer, whether it be used on one's opponent's fattie on the field or cleansing your creatures of -1/-1 counters if need be.  
  
The -12 gives one another win condition: 'nuff said.  
  
Yes, this is the best card in standard as of writing. Yes, this card is overpowered. No, it is not broken. No, it should not be banned.  
  
My two cents.
posts.html:

The -1 unsummon can also be a game changer, whether it be used on one's opponent's fattie on the field or cleansing your creatures of -1/-1 counters if need be.

The -12 gives one another win condition: 'nuff said.

Yes, this is the best card in standard as of writing. Yes, this card is overpowered. No, it is not broken. No, it should not be banned.

My two cents.

I **hate** this card.
  
So many blue decks use him as their sole win condition it's unreal.
  
How he hasn't been banned is beyond me.
  
If blue players get upset because they've lost their win condition, well, that's too bad.
  
This card stops the game being fun, almost single-handedly. That should be one factor that decides which cards are banned.
  
If wizards do as I hear and reprint this guy, I'll quit all forms of compettitive play and start only buying singles so wizards stops getting my money, unless they reprint Pithing Needle in the same set.
  
   
EDIT:
  
 Mill\_Master has proven my point for me.
  
Do you play the deck, or let it play itself while you get a beer?

Posted By: Mill_Master (4/10/2011 4:14:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Annoyilator  
  
The mana cost is a 'COST' of the spell. Cost is already paid when the spell is cast. It is too late to activate [Icy Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Icy Manipulator) to tap opponent's land. (even though, it is not enforced anymore, technically we have to tap our lands to produce mana, and than cast the spell.)   
Similarly, tapping the land is also COST of the land's ability. It has to be paid in order to produce mana. You cannot activate ability or cast spell in response to paying the cost.   
For example, if I am casting [reckless abandon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reckless abandon), the additional cost 'sacrifice a creature' have to be paid when I cast it. Opponent cannot respond by destroying the creature that I am paying for reckless abandon, since it is already in the graveyard.
posts.html:
@Annoyilator

The mana cost is a 'COST' of the spell. Cost is already paid when the spell is cast. It is too late to activate Icy Manipulator to tap opponent's land. (even though, it is not enforced anymore, technically we have to tap our lands to produce mana, and than cast the spell.)
Similarly, tapping the land is also COST of the land's ability. It has to be paid in order to produce mana. You cannot activate ability or cast spell in response to paying the cost.
For example, if I am casting reckless abandon, the additional cost 'sacrifice a creature' have to be paid when I cast it. Opponent cannot respond by destroying the creature that I am paying for reckless abandon, since it is already in the graveyard.
